attachments.title: Please enjoy some terrifying videos of malfunctioning animatronic monsters
attachments.text: The smash success of Five Nights At Freddy’s—a mobile game where you hide from murderous animatronics—was kind of a no-brainer when you consider that only the wide, innocent eyes of a child could look at a member of the Chuck E. Cheese house band without shitting themselves in fear. Sure, that’s obv
attachments.fallback: Please enjoy some terrifying videos of malfunctioning animatronic monsters

text: had a 1:1 call with Embodied to set up our next call, they really just want a usability-testable visual and light UX output, but strictly for the money outlined. Paolo and Kris, maybe Maja will be able to talk to us Monday 1:30 over skype, show us the robots, and answer some basic questions, which i will set up to be in three themes: 1) overall product/context, 2) goals for the output to be provided in phase 1 deliverables, and 3) what research is showing so far (particularly as relates to the asks in the RFP). budget seems pretty inflexible; they're concerned about demonstrating frugality/responsibility to the board as they head into needing to raise Series A beginning of next year.
interesting. When you say 'strictly for the money outlined', are we talking ALL the money outlined, or the first phase (25k)?
omg. FNAF is such a thing. my kidbot loves it. having never played it. so weird.
